PAD_KillRats.synopsis: Voicebark meant to inform players that they should just focus on killing rats.
PAD_KillRats.how_to_trigger: 1. Kill rats in shar temple2. Kill diplorat3. Go down to depths to start rat fight4. Make it to wave 2

PAD_RitualBook.synopsis: Player comments on the book on how to divide yourself into many.

AD_Prayer.synopsis: The rats squeak at the Shar statues as they pray to her.

AD_GrabAttention.synopsis: The rats squeak/hiss at the player to grab their attention
AD_GrabAttention.how_to_trigger: Leave the Negotiation dialog without agreeing to the truce. The rat that talked to you will follow and AD

RatsNegotiate.synopsis: The player continues to kill the rats. The rats begin to group up and attempt to bargain with the player. Their memories are starting to converge into a single consciousness of the last dark justiciar. Some players who accepted a quest from the Orthon may realise there is a Dark Justiciar in hiding, amongst these rats. If the player repeatedly talks to the rats at this point without accepting a truce, they'll turn hostile.
RatsNegotiate.how_to_trigger: Kill a third of the rats in Shar Temple then talk to them

RatsCalm.synopsis: By talking to the rats in the Shar Temple, the player begins to notice there are specific patterns to their behaviour. Communication with them is difficult as they are resistant to your presence and make cryptic statements. After engaging with the rats a few times, the player/there companions might note that there's something odd going on (to be unveiled later if they start killing rats)
RatsCalm.how_to_trigger: Talk with any of the rats in the Shar Temple while they are in the Calm state (this is their initial state - note that the rats could be in any number of locations within the Shar Temple)

JusticiarAppears.synopsis: After killing the final rat during the Ultimatum stage, one of the final rats returns to its humanoid form as Lyrthindor,  the Last Justiciar. He's furious that the player has blown his cover, and quickly turns hostile.
JusticiarAppears.how_to_trigger: 1. Trigger the Ultimatum stage of the last using oe SHA_LastJusticiar_SetState_Ultimatum or the Debug Book2. Go to -717; -37; -7463. Enter combat with the rats and kill them

AD_UltimatumLure.synopsis: The player can hear rats' squeaks and hisses coming from the bottom of the Shar Temple. This is meant to lure the player to the bottom of the temple.At this point the player has killed multiple rats and refused to negotiate with them.
AD_UltimatumLure.how_to_trigger: Enter the Ultimatum state during the Last Justiciar quest. Can be done with 'oe SHA_LastJusticiar_SetState_Ultimatum'

RatsUltimatum.synopsis: After killing too many rats, the swarm confronts the player in a chamber beneath the Orthon's lair. A fight ensues immediately afterwards.
RatsUltimatum.how_to_trigger: Killing a lot of rats in the Shar Temple and then get spotted by one of the rats

SpeakWithDead.synopsis: The player turned the Last Justiciar back into a humanoid by killing his rats. The player then proceeded to kill the Last Justiciar and talk to him using Speak With Dead.The Last Justiciar witnessed the Orthon attack and has been using his rat form to hide for years
SpeakWithDead.how_to_trigger: Kill the Last Justiciar then use Speak with Dead on him.Last Justiciar can be forced to appear with 'oe SHA_LastJusticiar_SetState_Apperance'

RatsPanicked.synopsis: After killing some of the rats, they become more panicked and aggressive - but also a litte more lucid- something the companions may pick up on. The may start to remember things -fragments of a memory, or a name on the tip of their tongue.
RatsPanicked.how_to_trigger: Kill a few of the rats in the Shar Temple then talk to them

PAD_RitualCircle.synopsis: Player comments on the infernal site that the Last Justiciar used to become a horde of rats. The player notes either that it has infernal origins or will be ignorant if the check failed. Karlach and Wyll always recognise the circle's nature.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Many of these sessions revolve around the player’s interactions with the rats in Shar Temple and the eventual appearance of the Last Justiciar. In an early state, the player first meets the rats when they are in their calm state. If the player talks to them before inflicting too much harm, the session 'RatsCalm' is triggered. However, once the player starts killing some rats, the rats become more agitated – a change reflected by the 'RatsPanicked' session. If the player kills an even larger portion of the rat horde (about one‐third) and then talks to them, the situation shifts into a negotiation phase, triggering the 'RatsNegotiate' session. At this juncture, the player has a choice. On one branch, if the player abandons the negotiation (for example by leaving the dialog without agreeing to a truce) the rats actively grab his attention – this is captured by the 'AD_GrabAttention' session. Alternatively, if the player continues down the path of excessive rat slaughter (implying refusal to negotiate and extra bloodshed) the game moves into an Ultimatum stage. In that branch, first the player is lured (AD_UltimatumLure is triggered) which then leads to a large hostile swarm encounter in 'RatsUltimatum'. The combat in this encounter eventually culminates in the transformation and appearance of the Last Justiciar in 'JusticiarAppears'. Finally, after the Last Justiciar is killed, the player can speak with him via 'SpeakWithDead'.  Because the negotiation branch (RatsNegotiate leading to AD_GrabAttention) is based on a milder reaction versus the more escalated chain of events (ultimatum lure, swarm confrontation, and emergence of the Justiciar), the sessions 'RatsPanicked' and 'RatsNegotiate' are mutually exclusive; a player essentially chooses between experiencing the milder ‘panicked’ branch or the full-blown negotiation → ultimatium → Justiciar branch. Likewise, within the negotiation branch, if the player opts to leave the negotiation early then AD_GrabAttention is triggered, while taking the ultimatum route via further killings (and hence angering the swarm) leads to AD_UltimatumLure instead – these two are alternative outcomes. Note that the PAD_* sessions (comments on killing rats, the ritual book, and the ritual circle) as well as AD_Prayer do not form part of this strict rat progression ordering and so are omitted from the ordering/exclusive lists.

PAD_KillRats_0.speaker: Player
PAD_KillRats_0.text: These rats can't keep it up forever - just have to outlast them.

PAD_RitualBook_0.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualBook_0.text: This speaks of magic that can divide someone into many... but many what?

RatsNegotiate_4.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_4.text: You kill many, but many remain. Stop. Spare our lives, or face my teeth and claws.
RatsNegotiate_4.context: NodeContext: On edge, seeking a truce

RatsNegotiate_1.text: Every little death fills my head with more thoughts. It's too much - too painful. Kill one more of us, and you will pay.
RatsNegotiate_1.context: NodeContext: On edge, seeking a truce

RatsNegotiate_49.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_49.text: I don't usually bargain with rats. If I let you live, what's in it for me?

RatsNegotiate_3.text: There are treasures. Useless to us now, but once they had value - meaning. We hid them away, untouched for a lifetime.

RatsNegotiate_61.text: Keep your word, and we will reveal them to you.

RatsNegotiate_18.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_18.text: All right. Your lives for this treasure. You'd better be level with me.

RatsNegotiate_32.text: And you better be true to your word. I am small, but we are many. Now fetch your prize, and leave.

RatsNegotiate_50.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_50.text: You're no ordinary rat, are you? None of you are.

RatsNegotiate_6.text: An ordinary rat alone. But together? Something more.

RatsNegotiate_35.text: Some remember turning away from the sun. Some remember donning a black cloak. Some remember plunging a blade into an innocent heart.

RatsNegotiate_34.text: But we all remember a name. Lyrthindor. We share who he was.

RatsNegotiate_41.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_41.text: *The rats are describing a Dark Justiciar's memories. The orthon's quarry was here all along, scattered and hidden in plain sight.*
RatsNegotiate_41.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the player learned of the terms of the Orthon's contract (kill all Dark justiciars)

RatsNegotiate_64.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_64.context: InternalNodeContext: This passive roll only if the player

RatsNegotiate_28.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_28.text: *The rat sounds like it's describing the sacred rites of Shar's Dark Justiciars.*

RatsNegotiate_60.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_60.context: InternalNodeContext: This passive roll only if the player

RatsNegotiate_26.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_26.text: *The rat sounds like it's describing Sharran rites of initiation - those of the Dark Justiciars.*

RatsNegotiate_69.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_69.text: One Shar follower turned into scores of rats? How can that be?

RatsNegotiate_43.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_43.text: Are you telling me you're one person turned into a swarm of rats? How can that be?

RatsNegotiate_8.text: It shouldn't be. We should be one, long dead. Instead we are many - scurrying, hiding, surviving.

RatsNegotiate_11.text: We are just crumbs of a life. Harmless nothings, unless you test us. Leave us in peace.

RatsNegotiate_21.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_21.text: There was an infernal bounty hunter seeking Dark Justiciars. Seems he missed a target.

RatsNegotiate_10.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_10.text: There's an infernal bounty hunter seeking Dark Justiciars. Seems he missed a target.

RatsNegotiate_14.text: The horned beast. He killed many, now you kill more. Leave us. Please.

RatsNegotiate_20.text: I am harmless - until we are cornered.

RatsNegotiate_16.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_16.text: *The rat's beady eyes hold your gaze intently. What does it want?*

RatsNegotiate_40.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_40.text: Remember your word - spare us, leave this place. Your reward awaits.

RatsNegotiate_47.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_47.text: A final warning - offer us peace, now, or be devoured.

RatsNegotiate_63.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_63.text: I'm not cutting deals with vermin. Do your worst.

RatsNegotiate_29.text: Fool. We gave you every opportunity, but still you choose death. So be it.

RatsNegotiate_25.text: At last, you see sense. Fetch your reward and leave us. Do not come back.

RatsNegotiate_0.text: No, you cannot leave - not without your word. Not without peace.

RatsNegotiate_55.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_55.text: *The rat stares at you. It almost seems like it wants your attention.*

RatsNegotiate_46.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_46.text: Scowl at the rat and shoo it away.

RatsNegotiate_51.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_51.text: Hold up your hands in peace.

RatsNegotiate_27.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_27.text: *The rat's eyes gleam with uncanny intelligence. It seems to grasp your gesture, and accept it.*

RatsNegotiate_48.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_48.text: Study the rat. Try to figure out what it wants.

RatsNegotiate_19.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_19.text: *It wants for you to leave it and its fellow rats in peace.*

RatsNegotiate_12.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_12.text: *It wants you to stop killing its fellow rats. Understandable enough.*

RatsNegotiate_22.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_22.text: *Beady, malicious eyes stare at you. The rat probably wants to feast on your corpse along with its friends.*

RatsNegotiate_56.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_56.text: We only seek peace. Kill no more, and we will let you live.

RatsNegotiate_31.speaker: Player
RatsNegotiate_31.text: Yell at the rat. Frighten it away.

RatsNegotiate_7.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_7.text: *The rat seems agitated, like it doesn't want you to leave. Not without getting what it wants.*

RatsNegotiate_67.speaker: Narrator
RatsNegotiate_67.text: *The rat watches intently, as if eager for you to leave.*

RatsCalm_6.speaker: Wyll
RatsCalm_6.text: Unworthy of dark cloak! Unworthy of dark fur! Unworthy!

RatsCalm_22.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsCalm_22.text: Chk. That rat's about to bite off more than it can chew.

RatsCalm_37.speaker: Shadowheart
RatsCalm_37.text: There's something strange about the vermin in this place. Can't put my finger on what though.

RatsCalm_10.speaker: Karlach
RatsCalm_10.text: That's a mean ol' rat. Wonder what's bothering it.

RatsCalm_70.speaker: Astarion
RatsCalm_70.text: Strange little beast. I would've made short work of it, once.

RatsCalm_31.speaker: Wyll
RatsCalm_31.text: The blighter's worked up. Wonder what's got under its skin?

RatsCalm_50.speaker: Gale
RatsCalm_50.text: As rats go, this one seems to be somewhat of an eccentric.

RatsCalm_66.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_66.text: *There's something strange about the rat. But what?*

RatsCalm_9.speaker: Wyll
RatsCalm_9.text: This is the path of heroes! Your feet sully it.

RatsCalm_29.speaker: Wyll
RatsCalm_29.text: We outnumber you, leave me be!

RatsCalm_83.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_83.text: The rodent needs a lesson in humility. Shoo it away, aggressively.

RatsCalm_26.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_26.text: Extend a hand to the rat. Show you mean no harm.

RatsCalm_51.speaker: Wyll
RatsCalm_51.text: Curious little thing. I respect its pluck.

RatsCalm_33.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsCalm_33.text: A rodent with an attitude. Not unlike a few githyanki I've known.

RatsCalm_68.speaker: Shadowheart
RatsCalm_68.text: Oddly brazen, for a rat. We should just move along.

RatsCalm_20.speaker: Karlach
RatsCalm_20.text: Spiteful little lad. Hint of malice in its eyes, too. That's not normal, is it?

RatsCalm_84.speaker: Astarion
RatsCalm_84.text: You're being held up by a snack. Leave the rodent and let's look around.

RatsCalm_71.speaker: Gale
RatsCalm_71.text: Defiant little fellow. Seems oddly... purposeful.

RatsCalm_21.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_21.text: *The rat holds its ground. It almost seems defiant.*

RatsCalm_52.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_52.text: *You fail to glean anything. It's just a rat.*

RatsCalm_28.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_28.text: *The rat has a thick coat and dark, staring eyes. Old, but in good health.*

RatsCalm_56.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_56.text: Study the rat's ki to see the source of its aggression.

RatsCalm_14.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_14.text: *Rats have ki, like all living things. But it is not usually this frenetic. Or powerful.*

RatsCalm_81.text: Unworthy! Unworthy to walk among friendly bones! Leave!

RatsCalm_39.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_39.text: Seems this place is important to you. Why?

RatsCalm_47.text: We've always been here - it's ours. We watch over it. You do not belong.

RatsCalm_49.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_49.text: You're just a rat - is it really wise to stand up to me?

RatsCalm_38.text: We are small, but many. Leave, or see what happens.

RatsCalm_55.speaker: Gale
RatsCalm_55.text: Extraordinary behaviour. There's more to these rats than meets their beady little eyes.

RatsCalm_24.speaker: Wyll
RatsCalm_24.text: That rodent's got the spirit of a centaur. I've got to respect it.

RatsCalm_19.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsCalm_19.text: A rat with delusions of grandeur. A bit like the gods themselves.

RatsCalm_54.speaker: Shadowheart
RatsCalm_54.text: Unwelcoming vermin aside, we need to explore this place.

RatsCalm_8.speaker: Karlach
RatsCalm_8.text: That sounded like a threat. I like threats.

RatsCalm_62.text: Leave! Away! My nest - my dark!

RatsCalm_75.speaker: Astarion
RatsCalm_75.text: Are you really being waylaid by a snack? Let's just look around, vermin be damned.
RatsCalm_75.context: NodeContext: Player is stuck in conversation with a rat, but Astarion's getting impatient

RatsCalm_16.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_16.text: Calm down. What are you talking about?

RatsCalm_1.text: Talking of you - intruder, invader, unworthy one! These halls are not for you!

RatsCalm_18.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_18.text: Back off, or I'll be scraping your guts off my heel in a moment.

RatsCalm_78.text: Try it. Lot more guts than you'd expect. A lot more!

RatsCalm_15.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_15.text: Consider the rat's tone, and choice of words.

RatsCalm_7.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_7.text: *The rat isn't merely territorial - it's proud. This place means a great deal to it.*

RatsCalm_67.speaker: Narrator
RatsCalm_67.text: *There's something amiss, but exactly what eludes you.*

RatsCalm_3.speaker: Player
RatsCalm_3.text: Study the rat's ki to see the source of its aggression.

RatsCalm_82.text: Join an army. Became an army. Leave!

JusticiarAppears_17.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A rat transforms into an elf. Its hisses and squeaks morph into the elf's cry of pain as he returns to his true form.

Keep the camera on the player while they react to the transformation

JusticiarAppears_10.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_10.text: These hands... too big. Where are the others? Where's the rest of me?!
JusticiarAppears_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at his own hands in confusionNodeContext: Groan of pain followed by anger and confusion as he looks down at his own hands in disbelief

JusticiarAppears_1.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_1.text: You - why did you have to keep prying? Why couldn't you just leave?!
JusticiarAppears_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks up from his hands to the player, angryNodeContext: Angry, irrational outburst. Looks up at the player on 'you'.

JusticiarAppears_6.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_6.text: Lyrthindor - last Dark Justiciar. I kept watch over Lady Shar's temple. Kept the faith alive, after all the others were killed.

JusticiarAppears_2.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_2.text: But you ruined it. Trespassed. Spoiled our - my - secret. Now you'll rot in the dark.
JusticiarAppears_2.context: NodeContext: Furious. Still mixed up, referring to himself in plural then correcting. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears_12.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_12.text: You mean Yurgir? I'm telling you, I didn't know. I was just trying to humour him so he'd let me go.

JusticiarAppears_4.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_4.text: You should have just ran from him. Now you'll die before me instead.

JusticiarAppears_24.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_24.text: I didn't know. I was just trying to humour Yurgir so he'd let me go.

JusticiarAppears_15.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_15.text: That devil. You should have just ran from him. Now you'll die before me instead.
JusticiarAppears_15.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears_13.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_13.text: I'm telling you, I didn't know. There's no need for violence - more violence.

JusticiarAppears_20.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_20.text: Wrong - you forced my hand. Now I'll make you into an offering for Lady Shar.
JusticiarAppears_20.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears_16.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_16.text: I didn't know. There's no need for violence - more violence.

JusticiarAppears_0.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_0.text: I'd never have struck at a fellow servant of Lady Shar, had I realised.

JusticiarAppears_18.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_18.text: Such ignorance is unworthy of the Nightsinger's followers. Her church will be stronger once you are dead.
JusticiarAppears_18.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears_5.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_5.text: I'm glad I did it. The world's better off without Shar worshippers skulking about.

JusticiarAppears_11.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_11.text: The world will never be rid of us - we are everywhere. But you...? Your miserable tale ends right now.
JusticiarAppears_11.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears_23.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_23.text: I'm sorry. What more can be said?

JusticiarAppears_25.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_25.text: Nothing. You had your chance to talk - now you die.
JusticiarAppears_25.context: NodeContext: Furious. Turns hostile immediately afterwards

JusticiarAppears_19.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_19.text: Wait - I didn't realise. There's no quarrel between us.

JusticiarAppears_9.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_9.text: Oh yes there is. All these years, I kept the Dark Lady's faith alive, against the odds, against the devil.

JusticiarAppears_8.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_8.text: Wait - I'm a child of Lady Shar, just like you. We're on the same side.

JusticiarAppears_7.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_7.text: My side is dead - just piles of old bones lying in the dark. You're nothing to me!

JusticiarAppears_27.speaker: Player
JusticiarAppears_27.text: Stand down. I completed the rites of this place. I am a Dark Justiciar, same as you.

JusticiarAppears_3.speaker: Lyrthindor
JusticiarAppears_3.text: No, there's no others. We - I - kept the faith, alone. You will not steal the Dark Lady's favour from me!
JusticiarAppears_3.context: NodeContext: Furious. Still mixed up, referring to himself in plural then correcting.

RatsUltimatum_0.speaker: Narrator
RatsUltimatum_0.text: *The rat utters a defiant hiss. Bloodlust fills its little black eyes.*

RatsUltimatum_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: A cacophony of angry hisses and squeaks builds. From the surrounding darkness, a large number of rat eyes glow.InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues after this dialogue.

RatsUltimatum_2.text: I pleaded, I bargained, I warned. You didn't listen - you made me remember again, hurt again. I am coming for you - all of me.

SpeakWithDead_22.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithDead_22.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SpeakWithDead_13.speaker: Player
SpeakWithDead_13.text: How did you become a swarm of rats?

SpeakWithDead_0.speaker: Player
SpeakWithDead_0.text: What brought you to this place?

SpeakWithDead_1.speaker: Player
SpeakWithDead_1.text: Oblivion? Why would you want that?

SpeakWithDead_6.speaker: Player
SpeakWithDead_6.text: How did you become a Dark Justiciar?

SpeakWithDead_11.speaker: Player
SpeakWithDead_11.text: Raphael hired the orthon to kill you - why would he then help you?

SpeakWithDead_9.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithDead_9.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

SpeakWithDead_3.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithDead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

SpeakWithDead_26.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithDead_26.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

SpeakWithDead_28.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithDead_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

RatsPanicked_13.speaker: Narrator
RatsPanicked_13.text: I was promised me a home, not a hunting ground. But who promised?
RatsPanicked_13.context: NodeContext: Some lucidity under the aggression/confusion. Half-remembering something

RatsPanicked_18.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsPanicked_18.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - animal soundNodeContext: SFX animal sound - do not record

RatsPanicked_44.speaker: Narrator
RatsPanicked_44.text: *The rat seems agitated, afraid. It must know that you killed some of its peers.*

RatsPanicked_4.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - animal soundNodeContext: SFX animal sound - do not record

RatsPanicked_14.speaker: Player
RatsPanicked_14.text: Raise your palms to the rat peacefully.

RatsPanicked_38.speaker: Narrator
RatsPanicked_38.text: *The rat stares, ever so slightly calmed.*

RatsPanicked_28.speaker: Narrator
RatsPanicked_28.text: *The rat issues a defensive, high-pitch squeak.*

RatsPanicked_26.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsPanicked_26.text: Another hunter, taking pieces of me. Hide. HIDE!
RatsPanicked_26.context: NodeContext: Calling out, panicked/combative (addressed to fellow rats in the broader temple region rather than the player)

RatsPanicked_31.text: My head's too full. It wants to burst - this is your fault. You slew my kin!
RatsPanicked_31.context: NodeContext: Agressive and pained, as if suffering a severe headache

RatsPanicked_15.text: Fiend! Bloodspiller! Unworthy wretch! Attack one, and you make foes of ALL!
RatsPanicked_15.context: NodeContext: Agressive and pained, as if suffering a severe headache

RatsPanicked_40.speaker: Player
RatsPanicked_40.text: You're upset about your fellow rats' deaths? I didn't expect such compassion from vermin.

RatsPanicked_1.text: I mourn them. I mourn me. It's your fault - you filled my skull with full of pain and dead mens' faces.

RatsPanicked_24.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsPanicked_24.text: These rats paint a vivid picture, do they not?

RatsPanicked_9.speaker: Lae'zel
RatsPanicked_9.text: These rats paint a vivid picture, do they not? Volo might learn a thing or two.

RatsPanicked_42.speaker: Astarion
RatsPanicked_42.text: Either I'm getting dumber or those rats sound a lot smarter than before.

RatsPanicked_27.speaker: Astarion
RatsPanicked_27.text: And it is the rats, to be clear. The rats sound smarter.
RatsPanicked_27.context: NodeContext: clarifying the line "either I'm getting dumber or the rats are getting smarter"  which preceded this

RatsPanicked_37.speaker: Gale
RatsPanicked_37.text: I'm not imagining it, am I? These rats' grasp of language seems to be improving.

RatsPanicked_16.speaker: Wyll
RatsPanicked_16.text: Is it just me, or are the rats here surprisingly... eloquent?

RatsPanicked_34.speaker: Shadowheart
RatsPanicked_34.text: I'm not imagining it, am I? These rats seem to be getting more articulate.

RatsPanicked_7.speaker: Karlach
RatsPanicked_7.text: There's something highly suspicious about these ever-more-eloquent rats.

RatsPanicked_8.speaker: Player
RatsPanicked_8.text: You're no ordinary rat, are you?

RatsPanicked_32.text: Very ordinary. But one of many - leave us be or we'll gnaw your rotten bones in the dark!

RatsPanicked_23.text: You make my head ache. You make me miss things I never had!

RatsPanicked_2.speaker: Player
RatsPanicked_2.text: You're babbling - probably diseased. I should just put you out of your misery.

RatsPanicked_5.text: Then my misery becomes another's! More fear, more pain, more memories!

RatsPanicked_39.text: I remember hands. Why do I remember having hands?

RatsPanicked_36.text: Save yourselves! Sacrifice yourselves! Run! Fight! Hide! Bite!
RatsPanicked_36.context: NodeContext: Calling out, panicked/combative (addressed to fellow rats in the broader temple region rather than the player)

RatsPanicked_43.text: Hands and fingers... long and hairless... horrible.

PAD_RitualCircle_0.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualCircle_0.text: A ritual circle. Seems to be infernal in nature.

PAD_RitualCircle_1.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualCircle_1.text: Infernal ritual markings. Ugh, what's waiting for us?

PAD_RitualCircle_2.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualCircle_2.text: An infernal circle, used for the casting of the Hells' most diabolical magic.

PAD_RitualCircle_3.speaker: Player
PAD_RitualCircle_3.text: What's this? For a ritual of some sort?
